cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 mi north of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the Gulf of Mexico, then turning northwest to north-northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas–Louisiana border (around Lake Charles / Port Arthur area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge watch San Luis Pass TX to Ocean Springs MS; Hurricane watch Port Bolivar TX to west of Morgan City LA; Tropical-storm watch south of Port Bolivar to San Luis Pass TX and eastward to Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in Texas west of Port Bolivar at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast (Port Bolivar eastward) and all of Louisiana coastline are expected to experience the core impacts of Laura
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Wednesday into early Thursday as Laura passes to the east.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible; highest values expected well east of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could drop 2–4 inches, with heavier totals remaining east of the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents in Matagorda Bay and near-shore Gulf waters may disrupt vessel movements.
